newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil futures fall across the board at close.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil futures fall across the board at close.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES - Prices closed lower on poor export estimates. Falls were seen across the board and the market expects more selling on speculation of lower Chicago soyoil prices tonight. April futures was seen supported at 1,250 and resistance at 1,270.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL - Also saw scattered dealings and interest was confined to nearby crude palm oil.
Traders said they expected the market to consolidate at around current levels while players wait for fresh leads.
Private crop forecaster Ivan Wong is due to release his crop report on Tuesday.
Technically, the market was well supported at around 1,250 ringgit for April futures. Resistance is seen at 1,270 ringgit.
Most active April futures contract fell four ringgit to close at 1,256 ringgit ($505.43) a tonne after drifting in a 12-ringgit range.
Physical Jan (south) crude palm oil was offered at 1,335 ringgit a tonne against bids at 1,330, after trading from 1,330 to 1,325.
Jan (central) was offered at 1,320 and bids at 1,310, and Jan (north) at 1,305 against 1,300.
Feb (south) saw offers at 1,335 with bids at 1,325 with earlier trades at 1,330 and 1,325. Feb (central) was offered at 1,310 against 1,300.
Among refined products, Feb RBD palm oil was offered at $560 a tonne FOB Malaysia and Mar at $552.50.
Feb RBD palm olein saw offers at $592.50, Mar at $580 and Apr/May/Jun at $570.
Feb/Mar RBD palm stearin was offered at $432.50 and Feb/Mar palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $297.50.
